definition: to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: The thugs' cruelty is the pet hate of the farmers in the neighbourhood.
sentences.chinese: 附近的农户对匪徒之残毒恨之入骨。

sentences.english: Then, somebody clap applauds , somebody hate sb's guts.
sentences.chinese: 于是，有人拍手叫好，有人恨之入骨。

sentences.english: She loved he deeply ago, moreover, her hated his guts.
sentences.chinese: 她过去曾深爱过他，但如今她对他恨之入骨。

sentences.english: She love he deeply in the past, But here her hate he deeply.
sentences.chinese: 她过去曾深爱过他，但如今她对他恨之入骨。

sentences.english: People in China viscerally hate corruption and are reluctant to see the death penalty dropped.
sentences.chinese: 在中国人们对腐败恨之入骨，不愿意看到死刑被废止。

sentences.english: Why your backyard the South America countries hate you so much?
sentences.chinese: 为什么你的后院，南美国家对你恨之入骨呢？

definition: to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
(of enemies) cannot live under the same sky/absolutely irreconcilable
to hate out of jealousy/to resent
